column4: i have a savage ix s3 video card and i am using the savage driver.  all i can get is 640x480.  any ideas?
how do i start and stop services in ubuntu from the terminal?  like in mandrake 'service foo start/stop/restart'.  i just installed snort and it started snort, but i don't want it running
lspci will tell you what exactly it is so you can Google for what the driver is called, then just "modprobe therightdriver"
it has the right driver, lspci and the 'system manager' thing have the same soundcard listed
You need to do "sudo modprobe drivername" then try doing something like "cat /dev/urandom > /dev/dsp" (use ctrl-c to stop it)
ok, i'll try that.  thanks.  how do i know the driver name?
If you add a module to /etc/modules then it will be loaded at boot and (hopefully) any starting services will use it
Well I don't use UAE much, since I have an Amiga right next to me
You finger users to sort of check each other out
Source isn't needed, only the headers
Also the kernel stuff has been renamed to "linux-image" "linux-headers" and "linux-source". Only the 2.4 branch has "kernel-xxxxxx"
